I now take refuge in the Buddha, the World-Honored One, praising his supreme virtues,
His timely words, truthful words, non-deceptive words, real words, Dharma words, and meaningful words,
His correct words, silent words, selfless words, revealing the gate of ultimate truth.
Manifesting various bodies, universally illuminating, always bestowing light and insight,
Opening the eyes of wisdom for all beings, destroying their ignorance and darkness,
The ten powers truly arise, having reached the supreme, cool ground.
Endowed with the four fearlessnesses and so forth, creating great light, holding the torch,
Developing bright flames, spreading light and illumination, bestowing the blazing mass of light,
Arousing firm and vigorous practice, not diminishing any supreme virtue.
The great lion's roar of the Shakyas, the one who can expound the unfettered true Dharma,
Is not tainted by the world's eight dharmas, the most supreme, pure, and compassionate one,
Brahma kings, Shakra, Vaishravana, and other gods all revere him.
Our Buddha always speaks skillfully, sweetly, profoundly, and extensively,
With the sounds of true suchness, liberation, and understanding all languages,
Vast and pure like space, born in the supreme royal family.
The Buddha's light is like the sun and moon, worshipped by devas, humans, and asuras,
Having attained the marvelous treasures of the seven factors of enlightenment, he establishes the supreme Dharma treasure banner,
Opening up the darkness of ignorance, his golden light-filled body shines brightly.
The supreme among humans, the honored one among humans, having severed the taints of greed, anger, and delusion,
Human-like bunari flowers, and various wonderful lotus flowers in the human realm.
Purifying the worries and sorrows of birth and death, ignorance and arrogance are all removed,
Forever closing the door to fighting, disputes, and lawsuits, forever severing the seeds of various afflictions.
Entrusting and transmitting the teachings without being stingy, destroying the banner of arrogance and raising the banner of the Dharma,
Turning the wheel of the true Dharma to benefit sentient beings, destroying the wheel of birth and death and ending all suffering.
The water of shamatha is tranquil and pure, like the ocean flowing deep without bottom,
Already able to dry up the source and flow of craving, therefore filling it with the water of merit,
Those who see it all give rise to a joyful mind, not attached to anything,
Able to give up one's body for sentient beings, with equal kindness and compassion towards both enemies and friends.
The color is like newly minted gold, the tongue is like a lotus flower, vast and pure,
The light of the body shines brightly and is pure, blazing like gold and like lightning.

Abiding in the supreme and wonderful joy of patience, having already severed all bonds of craving,

unstained, unadulterated, originally pure, bathing the body and mind, the Subduer,

Fully endowed with the thirty-two marks, further adorned with the eighty minor marks,
the body of a hundred merits, supremely wondrous, vast and supreme, without compare.
Already having mastery over all dharmas, revealing the pure supreme meaning gate,
the wisdom able to pervade all realms, the vajra of wisdom breaking through all afflictions.

With boundless speech and boundless merits, his eloquence is inexhaustible and also boundless.
The Buddha, the omniscient one, the unsurpassed honored one, I take refuge in the Buddha, the great benefactor,
I take refuge in the one who skillfully protects the world, and has heard all dharmas as they are.
With his own wisdom, he has penetrated the Dharma gates, I bow to the supreme knower of the Dharma,
First, with his own wisdom, he saw all dharmas, and attained the unsurpassed great enlightenment,
Later, he awakened sentient beings and benefited them in the same way, I bow to the true awakener of self and others.
He truly understands all pure practices, without breaking or cutting, with firm form and strength,
Complete, pure, and perfect, I bow to the practitioner of pure conduct.
Abiding in the Dharma of non-forgetfulness, the courageous, firm, and supreme honored one,
The Buddha's mind is vast and boundless, able to illuminate the nature of suffering and joy.

Taming, tranquility, and approaching tranquility, abiding in the supreme tamed mind,
Having entered the gate of the ultimate truth, I bow to the one who has already reached the ground of coolness.
With palms joined by all, making respectful salutations, he should receive the foremost offerings of humans and gods,

Understanding all dharmas without being able to surpass, the Buddha is the honored one of love and views,
Wisdom, love, and virtue boundless, I bow my head to the one who treats love and hatred equally.
The supreme deportment is loved by the assembly, and one is endowed with all kinds of eloquent abilities,

The characteristics of the Buddha's deportment are supreme and incomparable. Those who see him all give rise to a joyful mind,

Endowed with delicious flavors and wonderful sounds. I bow my head to the one whose speech is incomparable.
The Buddha is the one with great wisdom among humans, and he is also the supreme sage among humans,
Heretical views in the world do not arise. I bow my head to the one who is far removed from wrong thoughts and perceptions.
Having already put an end to worries, sorrows, and all suffering and distress,

Regarding benefit and non-benefit, he has no joy or anger, towards the arrogant he also gives rise to a mind of joy and abandonment,
Having no worries or troubles, faults do not arise, I bow my head to the one whose wisdom destroys false teachings.
Having already been able to abandon all troubles, he always teaches to be close to good people,

The speech is definitive and free from the world, I bow to the one who has already left behind all ignorance.
Having already abandoned inverted views, having already left behind frivolous and agitated conditions,
Having already left behind all non-verbal expressions, I bow to the one who guides with skillful speech.
Always practicing without flattery or deception, following the pure and true mind,
Widely practicing love and respect without falsehood, I bow to the one who has already crossed over the difficulties of birth and death.
All that is done is accomplished well, this is the gate of birth for the true Dharma,
Those who see it rejoice, O World-Honored One, I bow and take refuge in the pure being.
Taking refuge in the one who directly teaches the Dharma, according to the circumstances without turning back, removing afflictions,
Correctly and well understanding the gate of liberation, heading towards the realization of the true Dharma of enlightenment.
Without destroying the supreme and victorious Dharma, well opening the door to the peace and purity of the world,
